intro: Sidalcea scabra, commonly known as the scabrous checkermallow, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral. It produces showy, pink to purple flowers with five petals and a distinctive central column. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, giving them a scabrous texture, which is reflected in its scientific name.
